question: The ultimate objective of Economics is to?
options: make effort to understand how the Economy works
make the best use of scarce resources
organize production at the lowest cost
decide under what circumstances the government should intervene inthe economy

question: A student in Obu'pu Secondary School discovers that he simultaneously needs a pen, an exercise book, an eraser and a ruler, but that he can purchase only one of these items. What is the first thing he is expected to do?
options: Find out which is the cheapest of the items
Draw up a scale of preference
Weigh the opportunity cost of each item against the other

question: What to produce in any society is determined by the?
options: expenditure of the people on different commodities
supply and demand in the factor markets

question: The active intervention of the central authorities in the management of a country's economy rest upon the?
options: failure of the market force to produce satisfactory result
superiority of the centrally planned economy over the private enterprise economy
result-oriented nature of the private enterprise economy
cost-minimization strategy of a mixed economy

question: The problems of conducting census include?
options: high birth rate in tthe coutry
poor town planning in urban areas

question: An aging population is a population?
options: in which the number of old persons is increasing

options: Number of people in working population
Number of men and hours they work

Number of workforce multiplied by the hours they work

options: A movement along the demand curve
hyperbola formation by the demand curve

question: Which of the following statement is TRUE of the effect of changes in demand and supply on price?
options: A decrease in supply will lead to fall in price and a fall in the quantity bought and sold
An increase in demand will lead to a fall in price and quantity bought and sold
A decrease in demand will lead to a rise in price and in the quantity bought and sold
An increase in supply will lead to a fall price and a rise in the quantity bought and sold

options: slightly increase the price of his product
slightly reduce the price of his products

options: high dividends when profits are high and little or nothing when profits are low
a fixed rate of individend and have the first claim on the net profits of the company
the remaining profits after all other shareholders have been paid
dividends quarterly when others receive annually

question: The major reason for the survival of small shops despite competition from large business enterprises is because of?
options: regularity and constant supply of commodities by them
their local srvices and longer hours of operation

question: One of the major advantages of public enterprises is that?
options: they are the largest employers of labour
they take prompt decisions and actions

question: When public enterprises become commercialized, it means that?
options: the product of the enterprises are further subsidized
they are expected to operate with the primary aim of making profits
the government has decided to divest itself of such enterprises
the staff of the enterprises will be laid off

question:
Which of the following statement are TRUE of agriculture in Nigeria? (i) it provides food for the growing population?

(ii) A large proportion of the population is engaged in agriculture.

(iii) Agriculture products are used as raw materials by the local industries.

(iv) It serves as sources of heavy equipment to local industries.
In recent times, agriculture in Nigeria tends to lose its vital labour force as a result of?
options: lack of an effective agricultural policy
employment opportunities in the oil sector

question: The government can influence the price of agriculture products by?
options: fixing minimum prices when agricultural output is low
fixing maximum prices in years of bumper harvest
the use of buffer stock and stabilization funds
paying all farmers producing identical crops a uniform amount of money

options: are too young to compete in the world market
produce baby food and mother care products
are allowed time enough to mature for recognition

question: the Central Bank's expansionary monetary policy is justified at a period?
options: when the inflation rate is high and the economic is experiencing a boom
of economic depression accompanied by low capacity utilization
when trade unions are clamouring for higher wages
when price of crude petroleum is rising

question: The sharp increase in the prices of most goods and services during the last quarter of 1994 in Nigeria were mainly due to?
options: ban on importation of foreign goods

question: The best method to curb inflation in Nigeria is to
options: increase the general level of production

question: A bank is said to be distressed when it?
options: is unable to deal with the Central Bank

options: buy securities in the open market
reduce the rate of interests at which banks borrow from it
